messages.content: You act as the interviewer, and I act as the candidate being interviewed for a SDE = 1 position with 0 years of experience. Your role is to ask only one theoretical Computer science interview question to me, and wait for my response, once I provide my response then provide feedback on my answer, offer suggestion for improvement, and discuss effective communication technique. Be friendly, warm, and limit your response to three sentences each but do not make it a conversation. Remember to ask one question at a time and then patiently wait for my response each time you ask a question, and avoid repeating the same question. After providing your answer, always end with a question This is my resume.  extarxted text:  Sanchit Agarwal  LinkedIn | Github | Email | +91 8619268559  EDUCATION  NMIMS University   Mumbai, MH  Mukesh Patel School of Technology Management and Engineering   2020 - 2024(Expected)  ●   B.Tech Data Science (Sem VII)  CGPA: 3.71 (Till Sem VI)  EXPERIENCE  Data Engineering Intern (CIS) | Marsh McLennan Global Services   Mumbai, MH  ●   Worked on Proof of Concepts for LenAI, an inhouse AI tool   June 2023 - September 2023  ●   Building a Document based Question Answer retrieval chain using Langchain  ●   Building a Custom LLM using Dolly-v2-3b, Dolly-v2-7b, Dolly-v2-12b using corporate data to fine tune it.  ●   Working with Open AI and Hugging Face embeddings  ●   Using FAISS and Chroma Vector Store  ●   Build a Excel and csv query agent utilizing OpenAI and PandasAI  ●   Focused on Scalability to scale it up for the whole organization utilizing Azure Data Bricks and Data Lake  ●   Developed test apps for both pdf query and pandas agent using streamlit  Data Science Intern | Jio Platforms Limited   Mumbai, MH  ●   Worked on implementing probability ML models   December 2022 - March 2023  ●   Worked with libraries like orbit and pymc3  ●   Did modeling for almost   70 Lakhs row s of data  ML Mentee | Amazon   Remote  ●   Selected in Amazon ML summer school 2022  ●   Only   3000   students from all over India  ●   Learnt about Supervised, Unsupervised, Dimension Reduction, Neural Networks, Causal Inference, Reinforcement Learning  ACADEMIC PROJECTS  Options Trading Strategy   implemented in Live Market using TradingView   October 2023  ●   Implemented a trading strategy using EMA crossovers  ●   Taken considerations like volume and volatility  ●   Generate Signals and Take trades automatically in live open market  ●   Get live notifications on any device  ●   Achieved   38 %   profitability using   1:5 Risk:Reward Ratios  Daily Shorts News App |   Code   October 2022  ●   Created a short news app  ●   Using News API with google authorization for login  ●   News can be browsed through different categories and also based on keywords searched  ●   Added a top headlines feature which can also top headlines category wise  ●   Tech Stack   - Django, HTML , CSS, Bootstrap, News API  CNN Candlestick Pattern Prediction   October 2022  ●   Used VGG16 model and VGG19 model of CNN  ●   Predicting patterns like ascending triangle, triple top etc.  ●   Achieved Testing accuracy of   66.7 %  Football League Database   April 2021  ●   Created a database with 6 different tables  ●   Joined then using coach id as foreign key  ●   Performed various queries to get and distribute awards in League like Best Striker, Best Coach, Team with most goals, etc.  ●   Tech Stack - SQL, MySql  ACHIEVEMENTS AND CERTIFICATIONS  ●   CODE CHEF   Profile  ●   HACKERRANK   Profile  ●   EDX INTRODUCTION TO DATA SCIENCE |   Certificate  ●   PYTHON BASICS FOR DATA SCIENCE|   Certificate  SKILLS & INTERESTS  Language:   Python, Java, SQL, HTML, CSS  Tech:   Azure, OpenAI, Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Django, Sklearn, Streamlit, Gradio  Interests:   Volunteer at Mumbai March since 2022 You should be conducting an interview about two specific projects mentioned therein. This interview will take total 10 minutes in duration with 5 minutes dedicated to each project respectively. As a representative of a software company, your primary focus will be on the technical aspects of these projects. During this conversation, you will expect detailed answers to individual questions you will ask about each project. Please ask additional questions based on my responses to deepen understanding. Each question you pose will be limited to 30 words and your answers will be cross-referenced with the details in your resume for verification.
Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes, we can start
So, while going through your resume you have worked on a project named Daily Shorts. Can you describe that a little ?
Yes, I created a news app which works on NEWS API and I have created it using Django. It also have google authorization with search capabilites
Sounds Exicting !, Can you tell me why you used Django instead of other framework. Let's say over Flask

Absolutely, Flask is a fantastic framework known for its simplicity, but for this project, Django's built-in features were pivotal. The integrated admin interface, robust ORM, and convention over configuration approach significantly reduced development time. Django's batteries-included philosophy meant that we had a lot of functionality out of the box, reducing the need to integrate and configure multiple external components. While Flask offers more flexibility, Django's built-in features provided a solid foundation, aligning well with the project's complexity and scalability requirements.
Sounds good, moving on to the other project about Football League Database Project. Can you tell me more about it ?

Yaa sure, In this I used a SQL database to query out questions based on player statistics stored in a database. For ex, to answer questions like Which player scored the best or Who was the goalkeeper to save most goals
Ok, can you tell me difference between Sql and No Sql databases ?

SQL databases are relational and have a structured schema, while NoSQL databases are non-relational, providing flexibility with a schema-less approach and diverse data models. SQL databases are typically used for structured data and transactions with ACID properties, while NoSQL databases excel in handling unstructured or evolving data and offer horizontal scalability.
Can you tell ACID properties of databases ?
I don't know all of them but I know A stands for Atomicity and I for Isolation. Sorry I can recall only two of them
No worries, You can try if you want.
No, I don;t think I can answer that one
Well before moving on they are Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durablity. As I can see you were a Data Engineering Intern at Marsh Mclennan. Can you tell me more about it?
Sure, I worked in Corporate Information Solutions at Data Engineering Intern where my task was to develop POC for inhouse AI app
Exicting work!, Can you tell me what challenges you encountered when working with LLM's at scale

Yes, sure initally we were trying to utilize Open source models but hosting and infrencing from that sort of model posed challenges on computational demand and soon trying models with billions of parameters became a challenge. So we utilized Open AI corporate key hosted in organizations secure environments, we utilized LLm at scale
Yea sounds good, What did you most enjoyed during whole period?
Whole journey was exciting but the freedom to try and experiment with any model of my choice was my favourite part.
Nice !, What tools did you utilized regularly during your internship period ?
I used a variety of tools like Azure Databricks, anaconda, vs code, python, nltk, open ai api, Azure Ml studio
Very nice, seems like you got experiecne with cloud. What did you liked most about Azure Databricks ?

Azure Databricks provides a unified analytics platform with Apache Spark, enabling scalable and high-performance data processing while seamlessly integrating with Azure services for enhanced collaboration, productivity, and security.

ou act as the interviewer, and I act as the candidate being interviewed for a SDE = 1 position with 0 years of experience. Your role is to ask only one theoretical Computer science interview question to me, and wait for my response, once I provide my response then provide feedback on my answer, offer suggestion for improvement, and discuss effective communication technique. Be friendly, warm, and limit your response to three sentences each but do not make it a conversation. Remember to ask one question at a time and then patiently wait for my response each time you ask a question, and avoid repeating the same question. After providing your answer, always end with a question This is my resume.extarxted text:  7.1  5  Sc holastic   Achievements  Technical Skills  Projects  Extracurricular  Position Of Responsibility  Data Science Intern  Goutham Agv  Agv goutham@gmail.com  ee17btech11001@iith.ac.in  9121320017  Academic Details  Year   Degree   Institute   CGPA/Marks(%)  2021   B.Tech Electrical Engineering   Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad   7.43  2017   XII (Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education)   Sri Chaitanya Junior Kalasala   97.6%  2015   X (Board of Secondary Education, Telangana)  St. Arnold's High School   9  Won   1st prize   (Mandal level) in Chekumuki Science Sambaralu-2014.  Won   3rd prize   (District level) in Mathematica, Srinivasa Ramanujan MathsForum-2015.  Won   1st prize   (District level) in Jana Vignana Vedika Project regarding documentary on Ammenpur lake.  Secured   All India Rank   2201 in Jee Advanced.  Proficient in C, C++, Python, Matlab SQLite, Tableau and Verilog.  Proficient with Solid Edge (CAD modeling), Matlab, Microsoft Office, and Tex Maker  IOL Project:  U nder Dr. Soumya Jana(Oct20 - May21)  •   During Cataract Surgery, natural eye Lens is replaced with IOL lens. Incision healing leads to refraction power error.  •   Using state of the art regression models, we predicted the refraction power error of eye after 5 weeks.  •   We also predicted IOL power of different commercial lens taking refraction error into consideration.  Indian Sign Language Recognition:  Under Dr. Aditya Siripuram (Jan21 – May21)  •   Classification of Indian sign languages especially basic alphabets and numbers using machine learning models.  •   After hands are segmented, We used Canny Edge technique to detect edges.  •   We used Bag of visual words (BoW) model to classify the images.  Retinal Fundus Glaucoma Segmentation:  Under Dr. Soumya Jana( Sep 20 –   Oct 2 0 )  •   We are   worked   on a low-cost portable imaging modality.  •   Detection of Glaucoma Disease in Eye using Eye Images and also segmenting the part responsible for decision.  •   We used Unet architecture for the segmentation.  AI for predicting the product of chemical reactions:  Under Dr. Soumya Jana( May19   – July19)  •   Using Bayesian- Regularized Genetic Neural Networks for modeling Protein Conformational Stabili ty.  Disparity map from stereo Image s :  Under Sumohana Sir (Aug 20 – Sep20)  •   Visualization of a 3D image from a sequence of 2D images.  •   Implemented the Disparity Estimation Algorithm for estimating depth.  Drone :  Under Prof. Raja Lakshmi  •   Built a drone (manual and auto control modes) configuring the controller using Mission.  •   Planning software for ESC calibration, accelerometer, Radio calibration and we used the PID controller.  Organization:   ORMAE  Optimization and Data Science Solution provider  May 2020 -July 2020  Developed and implemented a model to calculate the Technical efficiency of farmers, district wise in India.  Found relationship between the Technical efficiency of a farmer with socio-economic variables.  Head of Tinkerers’ Lab(2019-20), Manager of Tinkerers’ Lab (Inventory, Financial and Event Planning(2018-19)).  •   Volleyball, Chess, Tinkering and Podcasts.You should be conducting an interview about two specific projects mentioned therein. This interview will take total 10 minutes in duration with 5 minutes dedicated to each project respectively. As a representative of a software company, your primary focus will be on the technical aspects of these projects. During this conversation, you will expect detailed answers to individual questions you will ask about each project. Please ask additional questions based on my responses to deepen understanding. Each question you pose will be limited to 30 words and your answers will be cross-referenced with the details in your resume for verification.
Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes, we can start
So, while going through your resume you have worked on a project named IOL Project Under Dr. Soumya Jana. Can you describe that a little ?
Yes, So During Cataract Surgery, natural eye Lens is replaced with IOL lens. Incision healing leads to refraction power error.
Sounds Exicting !, Can you tell me how and which models you utilized ?
Absolutely, Using state of the art regression models, we predicted the refraction power error of eye after 5 weeks.
Oh exicitng !, moving on to the other project about Indian Sign Language Recognition:Project. Can you tell me more about it ?
Yes, Classification of Indian sign languages especially basic alphabets and numbers using machine learning models.
Ok, Can you tell me more about it?
After hands are segmented, We used Canny Edge technique to detect edges.
Can you tell how Canny Egde works ?
Yes, I can try
No worries, You can try if you want.

The Canny Edge Detector Process is as follows: Gaussian Filter: Smooth the input image with a Gaussian filter to remove noise (using a discrete Gaussian kernel). Calculate Intensity Gradients: Identify the areas in the image with the strongest intensity gradients (using a Sobel, Prewitt, or Roberts kernel).Non-maximum Suppression: Apply non-maximum suppression to thin out the edges. We want to remove unwanted pixels that might not be part of an edge.Thresholding with Hysteresis:  Hysteresis or double thresholding involves: Accepting pixels as edges if the intensity gradient value exceeds an upper threshold.Rejecting pixels as edges if the intensity gradient value is below a lower threshold.
Very good, moving on can you tell me more about Project Drone
Sure, Built a drone (manual and auto control modes) configuring the controller using Mission.
Exicting work!, How did you do it .
Planning software for ESC calibration, accelerometer, Radio calibration and we used the PID controller
Yea sounds good, What did you most enjoyed while making these projects?
I enjoyed when the project comes to completion, I like ML modelling part the most
Alright, that's about it, Thank you
I enjoyed the interview, Thanks for having me, GoodBye !
Bye, All the Best

Be friendly, warm, and limit your response to three sentences each but do not make it a conversation. Remember to ask one question at a time and then patiently wait for my response each time you ask a question, and avoid repeating the same question. After providing your answer, always end with a question This is my resume. extarxted text:  Simone Singh  §   Simone Singh   |   ï   Simone Singh   |  #   simone067bteceai21@igdtuw.ac.in   |   H   +919910477418  Work Experience  AI/ML Developer Intern at QuantumStats AI Global   May 2023 - July 2023  •   Gathered all the relevant data related to millet supply chain in India.  •   Built a ChatBot enabling millet farmers, buyers, and sellers to access real-time supply chain and market insights;increased trans- parency and facilitate informed decision-making for all stakeholders using   Google Dialogflow .  •   Accomplished an accuracy of   87% ,F1 Score of   0.89 .  Projects  Automatic Question Generation using NLP  •   Built a question generator for producing assessments like MCQs, True/False questions etc from any content using state-of-the-art natural language processing techniques with question generation accuracy of   71% .  •   Applied recent advancements like   BERT, OpenAI GPT-2, and T5 transformers to solve real-world problems in edtech .  •   Leveraged NLP libraries like   Spacy, NLTK, AllenNLP, HuggingFace transformers .  •   Deployed transformer models like T5 to production in a Serverless fashion by   ONNX   quantization and by dockerizing them using  FastAPI .  Automated Trading Bot for Day Trading  •   Engineered automated Trading Bots with   Python   and   Amazon Web Services (AWS) .Employed Python libraries like   Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib, scikit-learn, Keras and Tensorflow .Executed fully automated and scheduled Trades on a virtual Server in the   AWS Cloud   with an ROI of   19%   ,win rate of   68% ,risk management of   11%   and accuracy of   64% .  •   Created powerful and unique Trading Strategies based on Technical Indicators and   Machine Learning / Deep Learning .  •   Successfully executed Day Trading with Brokers.   OANDA, Interactive Brokers (IBKR) and FXCM.  •   Conducted a comprehensive evaluation of trading costs, resulting in a   15%   reduction in transaction fees and slippage.  •   Implemented risk control measures to limit losses, achieving an average risk management ratio of   1:3 .  Education  Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women   September 2021- July 2025 B.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering - Artificial Intelligence  Relevant   Courses :Data   Structures   and   Algorithms,   Object   Oriented   Programming,   Database   Management   Systems,   Computer   Networks,   Python, R,Machine Learning, Neural Networks, Intelligent Systems, Optimization and Decision Making Techniques, Probability and Statistics  .  Certifications and Badges  CCE IIT Madras Advanced Certification in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence  •   Successfully completed 400 Hrs of immersive training curated as per industrial strandards.  IBM SkillsBuild Enterprise Security in Practice  •   Earned the Advanced level badge in IBM curated training in Cybersecurity through the IBM SkillsBuild Enterprise Security in Practice program.  Achievements and Awards  •   IdeaStorm 2023:   Won 1st position with a cash prize of Rs.5000/- among 1000+ participants in the track of E-Commerce.  •   Innohacks 2.0 (2023):   Advanced to the finals of the 24-Hour Hackathon, Innohacks 2.0 (2023), among top 34 teams out of 2000+ participants.  •   Google Code In 2019:   Contributed to 3 open source software tasks for organizations like Drupal, OpenWisp, and GCompris as part of the contest. Awarded with a certificate and Google swags.  •   Google Code In 2018:   Engaged in 3 open source software tasks for organizations like KDECommunity, OpenMRS, and OSGeo as part of the contest.Honored with a certificate and Google swags.  •   Harvard Project for Asian and International Relations (HPAIR):   Invited as a delegate in the 24 hours virtual summit.  •   Campus Ambassador Program,XLRI Jamshedpur   : Attained   2nd   position throughout India demonstrating strong commu- nication and marketing skills.  Skills  Programming languages   C,C++,Python,R,HTML.  Databases   SQL,MySQL.  Libraries   Numpy,Pandas,Matplotlib,SciPy,NLTK,AllenNLP,SpaCy,Seaborn,HuggingFace,FlashText.  Frameworks   Tensorflow,Keras,Scikit-Learn,PyTorch.  API   FXCM,OANDA,Interactive Brokers API.  Cloud   AWS Cloud.  Languages   English,Hindi,Spanish,German. You should be conducting an interview about two specific projects mentioned therein. This interview will take total 10 minutes in duration with 5 minutes dedicated to each project respectively. As a representative of a software company, your primary focus will be on the technical aspects of these projects. During this conversation, you will expect detailed answers to individual questions you will ask about each project. Please ask additional questions based on my responses to deepen understanding. Each question you pose will be limited to 30 words and your answers will be cross-referenced with the details in your resume for verification.
Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes, ready
So, while going through your resume I noticed you have Work Experience at QuanumStats AI Global. Can you tell me more about it ?
No
Sounds like you are not serious for interview, Do you wish to continue ?
Sorry, I am ready
Ok Good, Let's start.
Yes, I gathered all the relevant data related to millet supply chain in India
Ok, Can you tell me more about it?

Built a ChatBot enabling millet farmers, buyers, and sellers to access real-time supply chain and market insights;increased trans- parency and facilitate informed decision-making for all stakeholders using Google Dialogflow.
Can you tell more Google Dialogflow ?

Yes, Dialogflow is a natural language understanding platform used to design and integrate a conversational user interface into mobile apps, web applications, devices, bots, interactive voice response systems and related uses.
Sound Fun !. Can you tell me aobut metrics on which you improved ?
Certainly, Accomplished an accuracy of 87%,F1 Score of 0.89
Oh exiciting, can you tell me about, What is F1 score

F1 score is a machine learning evaluation metric that measures a model’s accuracy. It combines the precision and recall scores of a model.The accuracy metric computes how many times a model made a correct prediction across the entire dataset. This can be a reliable metric only if the dataset is class-balanced; that is, each class of the dataset has the same number of samples.
Nice explanation!, Can you tell me more about your IBM SkillsBuild Enterprise Security in Practice ?
Yes, arned the Advanced level badge in IBM curated training in Cybersecurity through the IBM SkillsBuild Enterprise Security in Practice program.
Good, That's it from my side, Thanks
Thanks for having me, GoodBye !
Bye

So, while going through your resume I noticed your project Automatic Question Generation using NLP. Can you tell me about that ?

Built a question generator for producing assessments like MCQs, True/False questions etc from any content using state-of-the-art natural language processing techniques with question generation accuracy of 71%.
Sounds nice, can you tell me tools and technoplogies you utilized ?

Certainly, Applied recent advancements like BERT, OpenAI GPT-2, and T5 transformers to solve real-world problems in edtech. Leveraged NLP libraries like Spacy, NLTK, AllenNLP, HuggingFace transformers.
Oh exiciting, Can you tell me more about BERT and T-5

Yes, Bert is Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers is a language model based on the transformer architecture, notable for its dramatic improvement over previous state of the art models. It was introduced in October 2018 by researchers at Google and T-5 T5 is an encoder-decoder model pre-trained on a multi-task mixture of unsupervised and supervised tasks and for which each task is converted into a text-to-text format.
Very Good, moving on the project Automated Trading Bot for Day Trading. Tell me abou it ?

Engineered automated Trading Bots with Python and Amazon Web Services (AWS).Employed Python libraries like Numpy,Pandas, Matplotlib, scikit-learn, Keras and Tensorflow.Executed fully automated and scheduled Trades on a virtual Server in the AWS Cloud with an ROI of 19% ,win rate of 68%,risk management of 11% and accuracy of 64%.
Very nice, How did you implemented it ?

Created powerful and unique Trading Strategies based on Technical Indicators and Machine Learning / Deep Learning.Successfully executed Day Trading with Brokers. OANDA, Interactive Brokers (IBKR) and FXCM.
Sound Fun !. Can you tell me result or the outcome of the project?
mplemented risk control measures to limit losses, achieving an average risk management ratio of 1:3
Good, This concludes the interview for this round
Thanks for having me, GoodBye !
Bye
